description: Discoveries of silver begin in north and central Europe
importance: Infused capital into Europe, helping economic development

description: St Denis cathedral completed in Paris
importance: The first monument of Gothic Architecture

description: Reading glasses invented in Northern Italy (Between 1268 and 1289)
importance: Extended the working life of scholars and artisans as well as improved productivity

description: St Thomas Aquinas begins writing Summa Theologica
importance: Gathered together all of the main questions of theology, doctrine, ethics, and more
Was the first degree-granting institution of higher education
Gave the most self-denying believers a home

description: Black death begins to spread through Europe (from China starting in Crimea in Europe)
importance: Killed up to one-third or one-half of the population in some regions

description: Charles VII of France establishes Europe's first standing army
importance: Gave an advantage to centralized monarchies, allowing for political absolutism

description: Philip and Alexander of Macedon begin combined-arms doctrine
importance: Created the most sophisticated and adaptable forces of ancient times

description: Colombus lands in the Bahamas on his first voyage
importance: In August 1492, Columbus sailed the ocean blue. October 12th they sighted land, And set their feet upon new sand

description: United East India company was founded
importance: It becomes the worlds first publically traded, multinational LLC

description: Permanent recapture of Jerusalem by Muslims
importance: The possesion of Jerusalem has been long contested by different religions

description: Johannes Gutenberg invents the printing press
importance: Helped to spread the printed word, allowing for easy reproduction of books

description: University of CÃ³rdoba library destroyed, along with its (estimated) 400,000 volumes
importance: This library would not be matched in size without a revolution in printing
It was a type of material that would spread writing throughout the world
Demonstrated a mastery of skill, to be renowned forever
Resulted in the death of some 20,000 Protestants throughout France

description: John Wyclif completes the first English-language translation of the Bible
importance: Helped spread Christianity to English speaking nations
